review_title: Profound job insecurity and "Big Brother" tactics.
pros: Most non-salaried employees are much like a family: there is genuine care and concern for each other, both on-the-job and off.
cons:
Management keeps information vital to employees "secret" and reveals it only to those deemed privileged. 
Nepotism and favoritism is common regardless of experience or qualifications.
Dismissal is common regardless of actual or invented causes or experience, job performance, etc.
Volunteering in mandatory.
Programs, policies, rules and responsibilities are enacted without developmental input from those expected to implement them and feedback is ignored.
Fear of retaliation for open communication with any level of manager.

review_title: Small Town Hospital Big City Attitude
pros: Flexible schedules, not many people in the organization held accountable for much.  Great Health Insurance.   There really isn't many positives that you can say about this organization.
cons: Because nobody is held accountable things are ran poorly and people can pretty much do as they please.  They create their own processes instead of following national guidelines.  Nurses are paid on average 5$ less than any other hospital in the area.  All other staff outside of administration is paid 45-60% less than the average for their job duties.  Administration and the Board only care about the size of their pockets.

pros: Working in the Heart and Vascular Center as an RN has been the best job I have had. The employees really work together and  direct management supports us well. There are a lot of little perks that get taken for granted, like having a say in your work scheduling.
cons: Upper management does not communicate well with those doing actual patient care. Everything seems to start as a rumor, even if it's a fact.  While having training is nice, coming in on days off every month gets a little tiresome.

review_title: Take  care of  the people that  take  care of people...
job_title: Certified Medial Technician/E M T in Ashland, KY
pros: If you live in the general area of the hospital, I guess that could be a pro for you not having to commute very far...
cons:
This facility is so called a "non-profit" organization.. The money made, above costs, or in the black, is suppose to go back into the business... There is way to many over paid exec's there hogging the money. If you are a care giver, you are under paid and over worked, and receive no real benefits that other's in same field receive. Example- Medical insurance.  If you need a procedure or test done at the place that employ's you, most hospitals cover that 100%.. Not at KDMC, you will pay 20%..     The "Good ole boy" scenario is alive and well at this company..
 Some of the best workers there have been discriminated against while the laziest people I have ever encountered do nothing. If the good worker "complains" then  the good worker gets in trouble !?!  The result of this happening over and over, means "good workers" end up fired or layed off...  What's left at the facility ?  Do you want care from these people ? Do you want to hire in and work in this environment ? This is a general over view.. There are some good people there, but they are not in the right position to make a difference or they are afraid for there job to try..

job_title: Food Service Worker in Ashland, KY
pros: The insurance and perks are nice. It was close to college and home for me.
cons: Don't even think about finishing school while working food service here. Management refuses to work with schedules, and will let you go without a second thought when you try to continue college. Management will also fire people for no good reason other than they simply don't like you before your 90 day probationary period is up.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Ashland, KY
pros: Everyone works as a team to get the job done. The facility is beautiful. The patient rooms are one patient only to a room. Good first job for new nurses.
cons: They make you flex from dayshift to night shift depending on the needs of the floor and there is no getting out of it. Everyone is hired flex now. No raises for the last 3 years and multiple  layoffs make for low morale and the feeling of poor job security.

pros: The people who work there are great people who really love what they are doing and how they are helping.
cons: The HR dept lies, cheats and screws you over on what they offer to you at the time of employment and then when bonus and raises comes finds holes to screw you out of your hard earned money.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Ashland, KY
pros: Coworkers, unit management, training, unfortunately this is about it. There are way more cons than pros at this time.
cons: Pay rate, no raises, work load, short staffed, pour insurance, upper management, turn over rate, out dated facility in half the hospital, the list goes on and on

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Ashland, KY
pros: Insurance. Co workers, they are what get me through the night. Meet a lot of people and really bonding atmosphere.
cons: Management needs some work and short staffed all the time. You will work a floor and nurses have 5 patients, which I think is dangerous especially when they are critical and pcts will have 20 and have no help because nurses are busy.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Ashland, KY
pros: Great people to work with. Team environment. The staff on the units do the best they can with what they have.
cons: Secretive Management. No Job Security. Short Staffed. There was never time to take a break. Very rarely was there time for lunch if you consider 5 minutes enough time to scarf down lunch.

review_title: Not a bad place to work.
